conversations.content: Could it be behind this door? ...Aye, it COULD!
Activating stonetech engine! Reactor mana charge risin'... 50 percent... 80 percent...100 percent!
Smithy Arm at full power!
Several days ago...
Human City Lazry's Workshop
Blast me! I can't even make a dent!
Hard to fathom a rokkan like me still don't have enough power. Guess they don't be callin' it the ＂continent's hardest ore＂ as a jape.
Still, I need this ore to produce a fine weapon. Without it, I'll just be losin' to Ramona and the lasses again.
I need more power. Which means...
Rokkan Settlement Mechanical Engineer's Workshop
Ho there, cousin! I'm lookin' to fashion a bit of a specialty machine.
What kind of machine are we talking about here?
I need a machine what can attach to me own arm and make me stronger. I need a Smithy Arm!
With a Smithy Arm, I can be breakin' up the hardest ore to fashion fine weapons what'll win me the Golden Anvil.
You mean the tournament they use to find the best smithy in the world?  Mmm, this is gonna be a tight order; that contest is coming up real soon.
But if it's a Smithy Arm you want, then I'll whip one up right away. I just got a new stonetech engine that'll be perfect for the job!
Nay, no need. Just give me the parts and I'll fashion it on me own.
No offense meant, cousin, but a true smith has to mine their own ore.
No offense taken. But while I appreciate your grit, you might want to reconsider. Fashioning machines and smithing weapons aren't the sa—
You there! Engineer! You're coming with us!
Who the heck are you?
Looks like this dog needs to learn who holds his leash. Hah!
Aaah!
Cousin!
Huh? Is this kid another engineer?
You got me. Still, might as well bring her along.
Argh!
...Hey, are you okay? Wake up!
Nnngh...
Am I...in a cart? ...Nnngh! I can't move me hands'n feet!
You've been tied up. Stop struggling before you do even more damage.
These people are wearing the crest of the Dyrenell Empire, but I can't figure out what they want for the life of me.
No talking, dog! Hah!
Nnngh!
Enough! This will all be for nothing if you beat him to a bloody pulp.
What's going on here? What do you want from us?
You're here to work, dog! You will build a new mechanical weapon in the service of the glorious empire!
You're scoopin' up engineers and smiths what to craft a WEAPON?
Aye, that's low. Real low.
If you're making some kind of machine, you only need engineers.
Lazry is a blacksmith, not an engineer. You should let her go.
A blacksmith, is it? Interesting.
Does that mean you'll let her go?
Ha! Not likely. Blacksmiths are being used to make weapons in a different area, so we'll be sending her there.
Then it looks like I have no choice... HAAAAAH!
Hey! Sit still!
Run, Lazry! Go!
What?!
Oww...
Can't believe those men are gonna force that poor engineer to build a weapon.
I bet gold to granite they're takin' him to the abandoned mine down the road.
I gotta be helpin' him, so I do.
He saved me life, and that's a debt I can't let go unpaid.
This sounds like a job for me Smithy Arm!
With that, I can tunnel into the mine and give the soldiers a proper thrashin'!
I feel right low usin' the engineer's workshop without tellin' the man, but I'm sure he'll understand.
Right then! Time to get to it!
Hmm... So this bit goes here, and this one goes...here?
Aye, there she is! Look at the power flow from that stonetech engine!
Except I'm not sure how to turn it off? Ach! The engine is runnin' outta control! Lemme just tinker with that...
Right then! She's ready for testin'!
Ow! Ow ow owwwww! Blast it all! Joints aren't supposed to be bendin' that way! Oooooow!
That engineer was right: Makin' machines is MUCH different from smithin'.
But I won't be givin' up—I'm gonna crack this nut and save him!
Hmm. I guess this part is next? Nay, but if I be doin' that...
Um, hello? ...Hello? HELLOOOOOOO!
Aaah! Oh, lass! Ye scared me!
Sorry, but I've been trying to get your attention for the last five minutes. Your concentration is impressive!
Anyway, do you know where the workshop master is? I'm supposed to deliver this.
I'm sorry, lass, but he went and got himself captured by the Empire.
What? No! Tell me everything!
...So that's why I'm makin' this machine in order to go'n save him.
In that case, you must let me help!
Look, that's your prototype, right? Let me examine it.
Oh man, this is a MESS! I bet you've never tried to build something like this before, have you?
Look, you can't just throw a bunch of existing parts into a complicated machine like this and hope it works out. You have to modify and tune them appropriately!
So that was the problem... Aye, it's true! I've no idea what I'm doin'!
Leave it to me! I'll make a blueprint with everything clearly labeled. Just modify the parts like it says and you'll be fine!
A fine plan indeed!
Don't get too excited. Even with a blueprint, the modifications will be a challenge.
This job will demand utter precision. Even the tiniest mistake will result in the entire machine collapsing.
Aye, she's gonna be a rough one, especially with time so short.
It's really a job for a team, but I guess you and I will just have to make do.
Oh, I can get ye a team.
Ramona and the other lasses would be perfect for this job.
I don't know who that is, but great! Bring the whole gang along!
Aye, but I do so hate askin' others for help...
This is not the time to be like that. If you can get help, then get it!
Okay, lass, okay! No need to go twistin' me arm so.
So this is rokkan machinery, huh? Well, you can leave it to us!
Hee hee! I'll start with this one and—
Nay, I've got that one.
I suppose I can work on this part here—
Nay, I'll do that one as well.
This one's mine.
Nay!
WHAT IS YOUR DEAL, LAZRY?! WHY ARE WE EVEN HERE?!
Seriously, Lazry, what's goin' on? You asked for our help, but now you seem all put out that we're here.
Aye, sorry, lasses. It's just... Well, I'm not much when it comes to acceptin' help.
Ye can't be the world's greatest smith without carryin' your own water.
Me granda taught me that, so he did.
Wait, so THAT'S why you always work alone? It's some old family tradition?
Aye.
But listen, Lazry—there's more than one path to being the world's greatest smith.
Oh?
Yep! Our father was a great smith in his own right, and he gave us a different way.
He certainly did. His motto was ＂Many hands make light work.＂
That's our workshop slogan!
Many hands make light work...
But proof is always better than debate, so sit back and watch our teamwork!
Hmm, this part needs precise detailing, which calls for...
A small, concentrated flame! Then I heat just the part we want to modify to soften it, and...
Done! All right, you two! It's your time to shine!
Lemme just cool that down... ZING!
And I will feed it some delicious mana.
This is amazing! They're crafting those complicated parts like it's nothing!
Aye, I've never seen such teamwork.
Well, not since they beat me in the Golden Anvil competition.
(I don't think me granda was wrong...)
(But the lasses aren't wrong either. There's clearly more'n one path.)
(Which means I gotta find me own!)
Have ye a moment, lass?
Sure, Lazry. What's up?
I was wonderin' if I could maybe... work with ye on this?
I've got much to learn about teamwork and cooperation, and I'm hopin' ye might be willin' to teach me.
We would be delighted.
Right then, Lazry! I'd like you to handle whichever part is made from the heaviest, hardest materials.
Aye, that would be the power reactor's stonetech engine. ...Hup!
Whooooa! I keep forgetting how freakin' STRONG you rokkans are!
Aye, leave the heavy liftin' to me!
(Once I learn from these lasses, I'll be well on me way to bein' the best!)
Fitting complete...and she's ready to go.
Smithy Arm...activated!
Hah! Yah!
Aye, but that feels fine, so it does. Me arm swings free'n easy!
Right. Movin' on to the next test. Stonetech engine...full power!
HAAAAAAH!
Holy snot! She just split that boulder in two like it was a pat of warm butter!
Aye, and it's all thanks to ye lasses. I'd never have been able to finish such a machine by me lonesome.
Exactly! When you work together,  your power goes beyond the limits  of what any single person can do.
Now let's go save that engineer!
Hmm? You're comin'?
Of course we are! It's all for one and one for all!
Nay, lass, I can't allow it. The mission is far too dangerous.
Okay, did we not JUST get done going on about how working together makes you stronger than working alone?
It's the same for fighting as it is for smithing, so just accept our help already!
Aye, you're right. In that case, I thank ye once again.
Yes!
I think the engineers are bein' held in this mine.
Wait, look! The entrance is guarded!
Can't you, like, tunnel through the walls with your Smithy Arm?
Aye, in theory—but I'm worried about the energy supply. I don't know how long of a tunnel I'd be able to make.
Plus, there's likely to be enemies inside, so I'd like to save as much energy as I can.
Good point. We're all in trouble if that thing conks out the moment we break in.
In that case, we'll distract them at the entrance while you sneak inside.
Everybody ready? Let's go!
Oh, I am GREAT at making distractions!
They will regret the day they ever came up with this awful plan.
You ready for your part, Lazry?
Huh? Wh-who goes there?!
Yaaaaaaaaaaah!
It's the enemy! To arms! To arm!
Come and get it! We're quite used to handling a crowd of customers!
Thanks, lasses. I won't let ye down.
Gotta make sure no one spots me...
Damn and blast! Soldiers!
So, uh, apparently we're under attack. Should we go up and help, oooooor...?
Hell no—let the other guards handle it. Besides, if we all run up to help, who's gonna guard the engineers?
Ha ha! Found ye!
Right then. Time to see what me arm can do!
I-intruder! INTRUDER!
Smithy Arm, engaged!
Aye, the day is won!
What the heck?!
You okay, cousin? Anyone hurt?
You're that blacksmith from before!
Aye, and I've come to save everyone!
Oh my gosh, you're amazing!
Er, why aren't ye movin', cousin?
I'm sorry, but...I'm staying. There's something I have to do.
Are ye daft? The Empire soldiers will be back any second!
I am willing to risk my life for the sake of my pride as an engineer.
We rokkans build machinery in order to help people, not hurt them.
So I can't leave until I destroy the terrible machine they made us build!
Nay, I'll take care of the machine. Make your escape while ye can.
But you'll be rushing headlong into the enemy! You're likely to die!
No one is dyin' today, cousin. Not so long as I have...THIS!
Holy cow. You finished your machine!
Aye, with help from the same friends who are outside fightin' for ye right now.
When they found out ye were in trouble, they pitched in to help make this arm... and taught me something important.
That's a favor that needs repaid, and I'll use me new strength to do it.
So when I say I'll destroy that machine, it's a promise ye can trust!
I think I underestimated you. You're a smith for true.
Okay, I'm outta here. Good luck!
Gragh! Hurgh...
*huff* *puff* They just keep comin'... I'll never reach the weapon at this rate.
Which means I only got one choice!
Ack! Guys, I think something just exploded down in the mine!
See that mana light coming up the shaft? The weapon we were working on used that exact type of mana in its reactor, which means it must have...exploded.
But what about Lazry?!
She's safe. She has to be.
She promised to compete against us in the next Golden Anvil, and she's not the type to break a promise.
Phew!
LAZRY!
How in the name of quartz did you manage to survive that explosion?
There were too many soldiers for me to reach your weapon, so I decided to throw a rock into its reactor instead.
Wait, you can't break a reactor with a rock. ...Unleeeess you have that arm of yours!
Aye! It let me throw the rock from a safe distance, then skedaddle on outta there.
Ye said machines are supposed to help folks, and that's just what me arm did.
Ha ha ha! Yes! Exactly!
I was wrong to ever doubt you, Lazry. You saved countless people AND protected the pride of engineers and smiths everywhere!
Which means the debt is paid for your savin' me life.
But I still got a promise to keep to the three lasses.
Darn right you do. We'll see you at the Golden Anvil!
Human City Lazry's Workshop
When you work together, your power goes beyond the limits of what any single person can do.
I am willing to risk my life for the sake of my pride as an engineer.
(There are other fine artisans besides me granda, and each has their own path.)
(I was walkin' the path you taught me. Goin' it alone.)
＂Make me stronger,＂ I said...
(There's more than just me physical strength that need reinforcin'. I know that now.)
If I find what that is, I bet I could make this sword here better, too...
(So once I find me own path, the Golden Anvil will be mine!)
Lazry! Emergency!
What's wrong, lasses?
The Golden Anvil is canceled!
Huh?!
The sponsor of the tournament is going to explain. Come on!
What's the meaning of this, guildmaster? Why aren't we holding the Golden Anvil?
Because of the Empire threat.
The Empire?
There have been increasing incidents of Empire soldiers kidnapping both engineers and blacksmiths of late.
Aye, we've seen it firsthand.
An Empire solider said they were forcin' smiths to make weapons off in some secret location.
And you think the Empire might come here?
I do. After all, if it's smiths they've want, we have the best in the world huddled together under a single roof.
The location of the Golden Anvil is no secret, so we have to assume the Empire is already on its way.
My first and greatest responsibility is to protect the participants, which is why we are canceling this year's tournament.
Aw, hellfire! I spent all year training for this moment!
Damn the Empire! This is just another in a long list of things they've stolen from us!
Nay. We won't let 'em do it.
Sorry, what?
I'm still tryin' to put what I mean to say into words...
Every artisan walks a different path. What's important to one can be less important to another.
But we all want the same thing in the end: To be the best we can be.
Which is why all those different paths meet up here at the Golden Anvil.
That's right! And we won't let the Empire or anyone else take it from us!
The tournament is worth the risk!
I won't let the Empire crush my dream!
Please, guildmaster! Don't cancel!
Your dreams and pride will mean nothing if you fall into the hands of the Empire.
Which is why we won't let it happen.
Now...WHO'S WITH ME?!
You have my anvil!
And my bellows!
To think you would all risk your lives for the glory of smithing... *sniff*
So be it. The tournament will proceed... but on one condition!
We are going to change the location.
You mean, like, to a place where the Empire isn't going to show up?
Aye, but where is that?
Oh, I've a much more active sort of plan in mind...
We'll show the Empire exactly what happens when you mess with us!
What the hell are those damn smiths playing at holding the Golden Anvil in a place like this?
No idea—and I don't care, neither. Ain't like a bunch of metalheads can stand against the Empire!
Haw haw haw! So true! ...Wait, here they come.
They've lined all their weapons up on a rack like it's some kind of show.
Ha! What fools! Time to go catch us a gaggle of blacksmiths.
Heh. Like lambs to the slaughter... Stonetech engine, activate!
What the hell?!
Those weapons are FLYING! RUUUUN!
A fine plan indeed, guildmaster.
Heh. Any rokkan can design a mechanism to send a few weapons through the air.
Now that our enemy is faltering, this is our chance! Push them back!
Leave it to us. Let's go, sisters!
I'm gonna show those Empire dogs just how sharp my weapons are!
Ha! I'll kill ten times your number!
Yaaaaah!
Arrrgh...
We'll protect the Golden Anvil with our own weapons!
Oh, the irony! Haaaaah!
Aaaargh...
C-clearly we were wrong to underestimate these blacksmiths.
I was hoping to take them back uninjured, but I have no choice. ...BRING IT OUT!
Yes, sir!
Graaaaagh!
D-damn! It's a fiend!
Do we have to fight THAT?!
This may be a little above your pay grade as smiths, guys. Leave the fiend to us!
I'll drench this thing to the bone! Take this! Droplet Slash!
Hee hee! Now I've got you!
And for the finishing blow... Arise, O flame! Haaaah!
Now THAT'S teamwork! No ugly fiend could possibly stand against—
GRAAAAAAAAGH!
Okay, THAT'S not good!
Ha ha! This fiend's outer skin is tougher than the continent's hardest ore! No blade can pierce it!
Guess that means it's up to me.
Let's do this, Smithy Arm!
Activating stonetech engine! Reactor mana charge risin'... 50 percent... 80 percent...100 percent!
Smithy Arm at full power!
Gragh?!
Glory be! She reduced the skin of that thing to ash!
Now, lasses!
Yaaaaaaaaah!
Graaaagh...
I-impossible... That fiend was invincible!
R-retreat! Retreeeeat!
Haw haw haw! Look at 'em run!
We win! The smiths win!
Oh man. We woulda been three dead ducks without Lazry and her arm.
Three cheers for Lazry!
Nay, the day wasn't won by me— it was won by all of us. After all, many hands make light work.
Someone stole our motto!
Are you gonna join our workshop now?
N-nay! I can't compete against ye if I'm part of your team!
Heh. Only joking, Lazry. Don't worry.
But we DO want you to help in our fight against the Empire.
Your fight? ...Aye, of course. That explains why you've such skill at battlin' fiends.
Fair enough. I'll join ye.
Oh, that's great!
The Empire won't stop comin' after smiths and engineers and the like.
But when they do, I'll be there to stand against 'em.
That's great, Lazry! Thank you!
Hee hee! They won't know what hit 'em when you unleash that arm!
We're all counting on you.
Thanks, lasses. But now, there's still the little matter of the Golden Anvil...
Oh, you know we're comin' for you. Come on, girls! Let's do this!
Golden Anvil Finals
This weapon represents all of our hard work and bonding as sisters!
Aye, and mine represents the bond I share with all rokkans.
I had a certain engineer make me a super-hot furnace and a special grinder...
And I used 'em to put all that I am into this weapon!
And now, the moment you've been waiting for. The winner of the Golden Anvil is...!
